LevelSet Function¶

class LevelSetFunction.LevelSetFunction(function, regularization_note=0, **kwargs)[source]¶

Builds an initial smooth function (Lipsschitz continuous) that represents the interface as the set where

\[\phi(x,y,t) = 0\]

is the curve.

The function has the following characteristics:

\[\begin{split}\begin{cases} \phi(x,y,t) > 0 & \textrm{for} & (x,y) \in \Omega\\ \phi(x,y,t) < 0 & \textrm{for} & (x,y) \not\in \Omega\\ \phi(x,y,t) = 0 & \textrm{for} & (x,y) \textrm{ on curve} \end{cases}\end{split}\]

Attributes

Methods

compute_dirac_delta(**kwargs)[source]¶

Computes the Dirac Delta function of phi: d(phi)

Parameters

  • regularization_note –

    • ‘0’ - no regularization:
      \[\begin{split}\begin{cases} d(x) = \phi & \textrm{if} & x >=0\\ d(x) = 0 & \textrm{if} & x < 0 \end{cases}\end{split}\]
    • ‘1’ - 1st regularization:
      \[\begin{split}\begin{cases} d(x) = 0 & \textrm{if} & |x| > \epsilon\\ d(x) = \frac{1}{2\epsilon}\cdot\left[1+\cos\left(\frac{\pi\cdot x}{\epsilon}\right)\right] & \textrm{if} & |x|<=\epsilon \end{cases}\end{split}\]
    • ‘2’ - 2nd regularization:
      \[d(x) = \frac{1}{\pi}\frac{\epsilon}{\epsilon^2 + x^2}\]

    • ‘3’ - replace dirac-delta with \(|\nabla \phi|\)

  • epsilon – for the 1st and 2nd regularizations

Returns

the dirac delta function. Also updates the class

compute_heaviside(**kwargs)[source]¶

Computes the Heaviside function of phi: H(phi)

Parameters

  • regularization_note –

    • ‘0’ - no regularization:
      \[\begin{split}\begin{cases} H(x) = 1 & \textrm{if} &x >= 0\\ H(x) = 0 & \textrm{if}& x < 0 \end{cases}\end{split}\]
    • ‘1’ - 1st regularization:
      \[\begin{split}\begin{cases} H(x) = 1 & \textrm{if} & x > \epsilon\\ H(x)=0 & \textrm{if} & x< -\epsilon\\ H(x)=0.5\cdot\left[1+\frac{x}{\epsilon} + \frac{1}{\pi}\cdot\sin\left(\frac{\pi\cdot x}{\epsilon}\right)\right] & \textrm{if} & |x| <= \epsilon \end{cases}\end{split}\]
    • ‘2’ - 2nd regularization:
      \[H(x) = 0.5\cdot\left[1+\frac{2}{\pi} \cdot \arctan\left(\frac{x}{\epsilon}\right)\right]\]

  • kwargs – epsilon - for the regularizations

Returns

the heaviside function. Also updates the class.

dirac_delta¶

Function’s dirac-delta according to the regularization note

static dist_from_circle(center_pt, radius, func_shape, **kwargs)[source]¶

Build a Lipshitz distance function from a circle, with a specific size

\[\phi(x,y,t) < 0 \quad \text{for } (x,y) \not\in \Omega\]
Parameters

  • center_pt (tuple) – center of the circle

  • radius (int) – radius of the circle

  • func_shape (tuple) – size of the function (height, width)

  • ksize – the kernel size for later processing. Default: 5

Returns

a level set function that its zero-set is the defined circle (approximately)

Return type

np.array

heaviside¶

Function’s heaviside according to the regularization note

kappa¶

Function’s curvature

regularization_note¶

Regularization note (0,1, or 2) for the Heaviside and the Dirac-Delta functions

reinitialization(dphi)[source]¶

Keeping phi close to a signed function.

This should keep

\[|\]

abla phi| pprox 1

Here we use:

\[\phi_t = S(\phi_0)\left(1- |\]

abla phi| )

where S is a smoothed signed function:

\[S(\phi_0) = \]

rac{phi_0}{sqrt{phi_0 + epsilon^2}, qquad epsilon = min(Delta x, Delta y)

assuming a grid.

param dphi

the delta to add to the current function

type dphi

np.array

update(new_function, **kwargs)[source]¶

Updates the function according to the new given function

Parameters

  • new_function – to update within the self.value

  • regularization_note – the regularization note (0,1, or 2) for the Heavisdie and the Dirac-Delta functions.

Function’s value (nd-array)
